title.rendered: The #1 House Flipper Secret? Cabinet Refacing.

content.rendered:
What’s the Best Way to Add Beauty (and Value) to Your Home?

Who doesn’t want a more beautiful kitchen? A kitchen you love and feel proud of every time you walk in? A kitchen that instantly raises the value of your property?

Yes, I know what you are going to say. You do want a new look for your kitchen, but remodeling costs thousands and thousands of dollars, and is a big, long headache.

Well, I have some good news for you. It doesn’t have to be.

The best way to quickly and economically give your kitchen a brand new, stylish look? By Refacing your cabinets! Your cabinets can single-handedly add more beauty and value to your kitchen than any other makeover you can think of. And while getting a whole new set of cabinets is super expensive and could take weeks to complete, Refacing your cabinets costs a fraction of the price and can be done in just THREE DAYS.

It’s simple. When you get new cabinets, they rip out the whole of the cabinets, and all the shelves, and start building them from scratch. But you don’t need to do that! Your cabinet’s structure is sturdy and was built to last. Your cabinets just need a facelift!

Cabinet Refacing does just that. Just swap out, or cover, all the visible exteriors of your cabinets- including cabinet sides, doors, drawers, knobs and anything else that makes your kitchen look old- and replace with beautiful new woods and stylish materials. This gives you an entirely new looking, fabulous kitchen, and you still get to keep your familiar shelves and layout. And remember, it’s only a fraction of the price of new cabinets!

Here’s a comparison of getting a new kitchen versus cabinet refacing:

New Kitchen
Cabinet Refacing

Time

Click Here for a FREE In-Home Cabinet Refacing Consultation – Limited Time Only!


 

1800Remodel sets you up with pre-screened and reputable local contractors from the biggest and most trusted names in home improvement. We show your project to several of these contractors, and they compete for your Cabinet Refacing project. And when contactors compete – YOU win!
